body: So the query itself works but fields are returned with uppercase names?

A global lowercase config option is a bit risky as users may already have case sensitive column names.

Passing the `$row` through this function [`array_change_key_case`](https://www.php.net/array_change_key_case) before accessing keys should work.

> So the query itself works but fields are returned with uppercase names?

Absolutely right!
The query works but fields are returned with uppercase names...

Hello,

This fix : 
            'attributes' => [PDO::ATTR_CASE => PDO::CASE_LOWER], 
creates a lot of regressions on my application (which is probably not following all the best practices but still)

However the array_change_key_case by @DavidOliver seems to fix it without any regressions.
Hoping that'll help
@alex-code that sounds like a good solution for schema issue. Would you like to prepare a pull request?

issue.title: MySQL 8.0.21: column names uppercase, leading to 'Undefined index: constraint_name'

repository.name: cms
repository.description: Build bespoke content experiences with Craft.

issue.body:
### Description

This seems to be a Yii issue, but I'm adding an issue here in case that helps the fix be included in Craft sooner once it's available. (Or even perhaps be worked around in the meantime if you think that's appropriate.)

https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/18171

After updating to MySQL 8.0.21, the following is raised:

> PHP Notice 'yii\base\ErrorException' with message 'Undefined index: constraint_name'                                                                          
> in /path/to/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/mysql/Schema.php:394

As I understand it, MySQL now returns the field names in uppercase, meaning the lowercase array indexes used in Yii's Schema.php don't work.

[This](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/18171#issuecomment-658155849) is a temporary workaround I'm using locally for development.

### Additional info

- Craft version: 3.4.27
- PHP version: 7.4.8
- Database driver & version: MySQL 8.0.21

body:
IMHO, need change sql query to:
```sql
SELECT
    kcu.CONSTRAINT_NAME as constraint_name,
    kcu.COLUMN_NAME as column_name,
    kcu.REFERENCED_TABLE_NAME as referenced_table_name,
    kcu.REFERENCED_COLUMN_NAME as referenced_column_name
    ...
```
similarly  function loadTableConstraints (in Schema.php) etc
What @darkdef posted is preferred if it works well in both version 8 and early versions.
If no one else wants to I can try and get a PR done tomorrow.

issue.title: Calendar module constraint missing

repository.name: calendar
repository.description: Create one-time or recurring events, invite and manage attendees, and keep track of all your events with the Calendar module.

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

1. Create a calendar event
2. Accept the calendar event
3. Set up a reminder for the calendar event

### What is the expected result?

A calendar event with a reminder.

### What do you get instead?

The entire platform is locked up with a server error and the following DB validation error:

```
Validating: Calendar Module (1 reminder entries)
PHP Notice 'yii\base\ErrorException' with message 'Undefined index: constraint_name' in /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/mysql/Schema.php:394
```

### Additional info
I've been running Humhub for almost a year now. I've updated/upgraded core + modules whenever prompted. This is the first time I've tried creating an event on the calendar. I'm guessing it is a failed constraint check because it triggers while testing the DB integrity on the Calendar Module (reminder entry).

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| HumHub version   | 1.5.3
| PHP version      | 7.3.14-1~deb10u1
| Operating system | Debian 10

### Full stack trace
```#0 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/mysql/Schema.php(394): yii\base\ErrorHandler->handleError(8, 'Undefined index...', '/var/www/html/p...', 394, Array)
#1 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/mysql/Schema.php(126): yii\db\mysql\Schema->findConstraints(Object(yii\db\TableSchema))
#2 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/Schema.php(754): yii\db\mysql\Schema->loadTableSchema('calendar_remind...')
#3 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/Schema.php(193): yii\db\Schema->getTableMetadata('calendar_remind...', 'schema', false)
#4 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveRecord.php(435): yii\db\Schema->getTableSchema('calendar_remind...')
#5 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveRecord.php(469): yii\db\ActiveRecord::getTableSchema()
#6 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/BaseActiveRecord.php(500): yii\db\ActiveRecord->attributes()
#7 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/BaseActiveRecord.php(291): yii\db\BaseActiveRecord->hasAttribute('active')
#8 /var/www/html/protected/modules/calendar/models/reminder/CalendarReminder.php(136): yii\db\BaseActiveRecord->__get('active')
#9 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/BaseObject.php(109): humhub\modules\calendar\models\reminder\CalendarReminder->init()
#10 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/BaseActiveRecord.php(1215): yii\base\BaseObject->__construct()
#11 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveQueryTrait.php(121): yii\db\BaseActiveRecord::instantiate(Array)
#12 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/ActiveQuery.php(219): yii\db\ActiveQuery->createModels(Array)

#16 [internal function]: humhub\modules\calendar\Events::onIntegrityCheck(Object(yii\base\Event))
#17 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Event.php(312): call_user_func(Array, Object(yii\base\Event))
#18 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Component.php(636): yii\base\Event::trigger('humhub\\commands...', 'run', Object(yii\base\Event))
#19 /var/www/html/protected/humhub/commands/IntegrityController.php(39): yii\base\Component->trigger('run')
#20 [internal function]: humhub\commands\IntegrityController->actionRun()
#21 /var/www/html/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/InlineAction.php(57): call_user_func_array(Array, Array)
